byline.contributor: Alison Smale contributed reporting from Berlin.

abstract: Russian military court finds Ukrainian filmmaker Oleg Sentsov guilty of terrorist acts and plots in Crimean Peninsula, and sentences him to 20 years in prison camp; also sentences ecologist Aleksandr Kolchenko to 10 years as accomplice; Ukrainian officials condemn trial and European and Russian filmmakers speak out in support of Sentsov.
lead_paragraph: The filmmaker, Oleg Sentsov, was convicted of terrorist acts in the Crimean Peninsula, which Russia annexed last year.

headline.main: Russia Gives Ukrainian Filmmaker Oleg Sentsov a 20-Year Sentence
headline.print_headline: Filmmaker From Ukraine Sent to Prison by Russians

snippet: The filmmaker, Oleg Sentsov, was convicted of terrorist acts in the Crimean Peninsula, which Russia annexed last year.
